English (United States)(en-US): My body aches a bit from\nexploring Earth’s bright beauty.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지구의 밝음과 아름다움 사이를 탐험\n하느라 몸이 조금 저리게 되었지만

English (United States)(en-US): But it was worth it, since\nI discovered this place!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럴 만한 가치가 있었지.\n이곳을 찾게 되었으니!

English (United States)(en-US): A small, cozy corner.\nIt’s a lot like me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 작고 구석진 모퉁이. 나를 닮은 곳.

English (United States)(en-US): Dark. Cramped. Grimy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아이, 어두워. 비좁아. 지저분해.

English (United States)(en-US): Like a hug from a sticky shadow.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 끈적한 그림자가 감싸는 것 같지.

English (United States)(en-US): Is this it? Is this where I’ll meet\nmy very own amazing ‘human’?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이곳일까? 나의 멋진\n‘인간’을 만나게 될 곳?

English (United States)(en-US): Ahh!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으아아!

English (United States)(en-US): Ahhhh!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으아아아아!

English (United States)(en-US): Ahhhhhhh!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으아아아아아아아!

English (United States)(en-US): My darkness. My darkness is gone.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 어둠. 나의 어둠이 사라졌어.

English (United States)(en-US): It seems my journey on Earth now ends under the feet of this humongous monster.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 지구에서의 여정은 따가운 빛에 물어뜯기다\n저 거대한 괴물에 발에 밟히며 끝나겠구나....

English (United States)(en-US): Is life really this fleeting?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 역시 삶은 덧없는 것이었나?

English (United States)(en-US): One day shining radiantly\nlike a dream marble,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈 구슬처럼 영롱히 빛나다가도

English (United States)(en-US): And dropped into a vicious,\nmuddy pit the next?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 언제든지 포악한 구덩이의 진창\n속으로 빠져 버릴 수 있는 것?

English (United States)(en-US): For what did I dream, staring\nat Earth all this time?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 대체 무엇을 위해\n지구를 바라보며 꿈을 꾸었지?

English (United States)(en-US): (What’s that? I’m scared, but I won’t show it.)|(’Humongous monster’?! I’m human, a nice one, even...!)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (저, 저게 뭐야? 무섭다. 하지만 티를 낼 수는 없지.)|(’거대 괴물’이라니...! 난 선량한 인간이다....)

English (United States)(en-US): Monster, dream marble, pit? What?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 괴물, 꿈 구슬, 구덩이? 뭐?

English (United States)(en-US): (Is it an alien? A monster?\nWhatever it is, it’s talking...!)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (외계인인가? 괴물? 이게\n뭐든... ‘말’을 하고 있어...!)

English (United States)(en-US): (Is it frightened? But why?\nI’m the one who should be scared!)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (겁에 질린 건가? 하지만 왜?\n내가 제일 무서워야 하지 않나?)

English (United States)(en-US): (Okay, let’s take a deep breath...\nInhale, exhale.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (우선 심호흡을 하고... 후 하.)

English (United States)(en-US): Hey, I won’t hurt you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 저기, 나는 너를 해치지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): I won’t push you into a muddy pit,\nyou Unidentified Black Blob.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정체 모를 검정 덩어리, 진창\n같은 곳에 떨어질 일은 없을 거야....

English (United States)(en-US): I also have no intention of stepping\non you, if that’s what you mean.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우선 나는 너를 밟지 않을 생각이거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Like I said, I won’t hurt you.\nYou can calm down.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니까... 너를 해치지\n않겠다는 뜻이야. 진정해도 돼.

English (United States)(en-US): Won’t hurt me? Won’t hurt me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 해치지 않아? 해치지 않아?

English (United States)(en-US): ...My darkness. Your attack began the\nmoment you ripped away my darkness.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 나의 어둠. 그것을 뜯어 간\n순간 나는 이미 다쳐 버렸는걸.

English (United States)(en-US): Uh, s, sorry.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어어, 미, 미안.

English (United States)(en-US): I guess the sudden brightness must have\nshocked you. Here, I’ll bring it back.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 갑자기 밝아져서 놀랐구나.\n여기... 돌려 줄게.

English (United States)(en-US): (Let’s wait until that\nmystery blob calms down.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (저 정체 모를 덩어리가\n진정되기까지만이라도 기다리자.)

English (United States)(en-US): You ripped away my darkness and disturbed\nmy peace, but you also gave it back.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 나의 어둠을 앗아가고 평화를\n깨뜨렸지만 그래도 다시 돌려주었어.

English (United States)(en-US): You are kind.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 친절하구나?

English (United States)(en-US): I really didn’t mean to rip away\nanything of yours.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말이지 빼앗아 갈 생각은 없었어.

English (United States)(en-US): I just opened the bookshelf cabinet door\nlike any other day.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어느 평범한 하루처럼 책장\n문을 열었을 뿐이야.

English (United States)(en-US): ... My cabinet door... In my house.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): .... 나의 집에 놓인... 내 책장 문을.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh my, so this place belongs to you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이런, 이 공간은 원래 너의 것이었구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Please excuse me. But there is\nsomething I really need to say!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 실례를 했어. 그렇지만 꼭\n하고 싶은 말이 있는데!

English (United States)(en-US): This corner of the wooden structure is\na beautiful, safe, and ugly place, truly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 목재 조형물의 모퉁이는 정말\n아름답고 안전하고 못난 곳이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Thanks to it, I could rest wholeheartedly\nfor the first time since arriving on Earth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 덕분에 지구에 와 처음으로\n온전하게 안락해질 수 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): The bookshelf corner, you mean? You like it there,\nhuh. I don’t remember dusting it...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 책장 구석? 거기가 좋았구나.\n먼지 안 닦았을 텐데...

English (United States)(en-US): Well, thanks for the compliment. (If it is one?)|In any case... I wasn't the one intruding here.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모쪼록 칭찬 고마워. 칭찬이... 맞다면?|아무튼 침범한 쪽은 내가 아니라고...

English (United States)(en-US): You are the first creature I’ve met on Earth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 내가 지구에서 만난\n첫 번째 생명체.

English (United States)(en-US): You have become a precious symbol\nthat will live on in my memory.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 기억에 오래 남을 소중한\n상징이 됐어.

English (United States)(en-US): What are you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 뭐야?

English (United States)(en-US): I am <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 <nickname>(이)야.

English (United States)(en-US): What characteristics does\nthe <nickname> species possess?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname> 종족은 어떤\n특성을 가지고 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, that’s actually my name.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 그건 내 이름이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Ah! Name. Name. Name, the sign of being.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아! 이름. 이름. 이름은\n존재의 표지 같은 것.

English (United States)(en-US): When one’s name is called,\nthe soul sways restlessly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이름이 불릴 때면\n영혼은 가벼이 들썩이지.

English (United States)(en-US): I am ‘Dot.’ The beings I met on\nthe Moon gave me this name.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 ‘뭉치’야. 달에서 알게\n된 이들이 지어 주었어.

English (United States)(en-US): ...Huh? The Moon?
Who lives on the Moon?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에 누가 살고 있니?

English (United States)(en-US): Many beings!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 아주 많은 이들이 살지!

English (United States)(en-US): The dark side of the Moon has a Dream\nFactory that creates human dreams!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 뒤편에는 ‘인간’들이 잘 때 꾸는\n꿈을 만드는 아름다운 꿈 공장이 있어!

English (United States)(en-US): Above and below the factory, the workers\nwho create and oversee dreams
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 공장 위에서 꿈을 만들고\n검수하는 직원들도,

English (United States)(en-US): And the cleaners who dispose of the Filth\nfrom dreams unfit for delivery,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 공장 아래에서 송출되지 못한\n꿈들의 폐기물을 치우는 청소부들도

English (United States)(en-US): They all live full-fledged lives on the Moon!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모두 달 위에서 어엿하게\n살아 있고 말고!

English (United States)(en-US): (Confusing.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (혼란하다.)

English (United States)(en-US): (A black blob appears out of nowhere\nand starts talking)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (검은 덩어리가 내 집에 떨어져 말을\n주고받는 이 상황조차 믿기지 않는데)

English (United States)(en-US): (더 믿기 힘든 이야기를 꺼내니 당황스러운걸.)|(저 동화적이고 가슴 뛰는 이야긴 뭐지?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (더 믿기 힘든 이야기를 꺼내니 당황스러운걸.)|(저 동화적이고 가슴 뛰는 이야긴 뭐지?)

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, my. That cloud has floated to over\nthere already! There is no time to waste.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 이런. 벌써 구름이 저만큼이나\n흘러가 버렸다니! 지체할 시간이 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): Would it be possible for you to\ntake me to a ‘human’?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혹시 나를 ‘인간’에게\n데려다 줄 수 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): I’m sure Red, Sir Cello, and Edison are\nlooking down from the Moon, elated.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드와 첼로 경, 그리고 에디슨이 달에서\n내려다보며 한껏 기대하고 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Oof. If you don’t know what a human is......
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 저런. 혹시 인간이\n뭐지 모른다면......

English (United States)(en-US): I’m ready to leave now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 이제 떠날 준비가 됐어.

English (United States)(en-US): With somewhere to return to, departure\nis no longer a farewell but an adventure!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 돌아갈 곳이 있다면 떠나는 행위는 작별이 아닌 모험이 되지!

English (United States)(en-US): An adventure, that sounds cool.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모험이라, 멋진걸?

English (United States)(en-US): Adventure. Adventure...!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 산책. 모험. 산책. 모험.

English (United States)(en-US): I am ready to leave.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 떠날 준비가 됐어.

English (United States)(en-US): I am ready to leave!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 떠날 준비가 됐어!

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, are you really ready to leave?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 떠날 준비가 아직 안 됐어...?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes! I am ready to leave!\nI’ll be fine. Fine.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니! 떠날 준비가 됐어! 나는 괜찮을 거야. 괜찮을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, I’ll be brave and go.\nI’ll be back, safe and alive, hopefully...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼, <nickname>, 용기 있게 다녀올게. 반드시 안전하게 살아서....

English (United States)(en-US): Oh!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어!

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, you’ve made it back safely\nin one single round piece!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 죽지 않고 원형 몸체\n그대로 성하게 돌아왔구나!

English (United States)(en-US): Yes... an extraordinary,\nenthralling exprience!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응... 산책이란 특색 있고\n새콤한 경험이었어!

English (United States)(en-US): It would have been more pleasant\nif my body was colored like that of a dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 몸이 꿈처럼 예쁘게 채색된\n모양이었다면 더욱 투명히 기뻐했겠지만....

English (United States)(en-US): But I am instead foul, lumpy, and black...\njust a useless dark spot in the world.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 끔찍한 검정 덩어리. 만물 사이에서 홀로\n새까만 채로 존재하는 게 어찌나 고독한 일이던지.

English (United States)(en-US): But it was alright. I was able to quietly\nhumans people going their way!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래도 괜찮아. 길거리를 걸어다니는 수많은 인간들을 소리 없이 구경할 수 있었으니까!

English (United States)(en-US): (Curious. I thought Dot liked the dark?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (문득 궁금해. 뭉치,\n어둠을 좋아하지 않았던가?)

English (United States)(en-US): (So why do they dislike their body so?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (자신의 검은 몸은 왜 싫어하는 거지?)

English (United States)(en-US): But Dot, don’t you like\ndark places and shadows?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 그런데 뭉치는 어둑한\n장소들과 그림자를 좋아하지 않아?

English (United States)(en-US): You’re scared of the light, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 빛을 무서워하는 거지?

English (United States)(en-US): ... You paid attention and remembered!\nYes. That’s exactly it!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 세심하게 관찰하고 기억해 주었구나!\n맞아. 정확해!

English (United States)(en-US): Um, but you don’t seem to like your body\ndespite it being a similar shade. Why is that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그, 그런데 공교롭게도 너의 검은 몸은\n싫어하는 것 같네. 왜 그런 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Hm... hm. Hmm.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음... 음. 으음.

English (United States)(en-US): I like the dark because it\nresembles me. It’s comforting.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어둠은 나를 닮아 좋아. 편안해.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s a safe space for me when\nthe light tries to erase me whole.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 빛이 나를 지워 버리려 들 때, 내가 안전하게\n존재할 수 있는 공간이 되어 주거든.

English (United States)(en-US): The dark is a snug and loving peace.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어둠은 포근하고 자애로운 평화야.

English (United States)(en-US): The black is... different. An infinitely\nexpanding void that robs one of sight.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 암흑은... 달라. 그것은 한 치\n앞도 볼 수 없는 무한 증식의 공간.

English (United States)(en-US): It hides all, and ironically reveals\nall in the cruelest of ways.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 것을 가리기에 역설적으로 모든 걸\n가장 잔인한 방식으로 들춰 내지.

English (United States)(en-US): Beings with vicious, sharp teeth lurk within.\nThose I cannot even name...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 속엔 가장 잔혹하고 날카로운 이를 가진\n존재들이 스멀거려. 차마 이름을 댈 수도 없는....

English (United States)(en-US): I get it. The right amount\nof dark is a place to relax,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 알 것 같아. 적당히 내려앉은\n어둠은 편히 쉴 수 있는 공간,

English (United States)(en-US): one where imagination can stretch its legs
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 상상력이 다리를 쭉\n뻗을 수 있는 공간이지만

English (United States)(en-US): but a small room with zero light, or a park\nin the dead of night was always scary.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 깜깜한 독방이나, 가로등이 고장 난\n야밤의 공원은 늘 두려움의 존재였어.

English (United States)(en-US): You caught right on to the nuanced\ndifference between the two.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어둠과 암흑은 꽤나 닮아서 헷갈려 할 것\n같았는데! 단박에 이해해 주다니.

English (United States)(en-US): My blackness... is like that.\nA fearful, filthy sort of thing...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 검정은... 그런 검정이거든. 해롭고,\n두렵고, 불결한 꿈 폐기물의 검정....

English (United States)(en-US): No, no. I don't want\nto talk about it anymore.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아. 아니. 더는 이야기하고 싶지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): Would it be alright for me to regale\nyou with tales from my walk instead?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 대신 나의 산책에 대한 이야기를\n마음껏 풀어헤쳐 보아도 될까?

English (United States)(en-US): If that makes you comfortable.\nWould you like to start?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음, 네가 그게 편하다면\n그렇게 하자. 이야기해 줄래?

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, the truth is...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, <nickname>, 실은....

English (United States)(en-US): Huh?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응?

English (United States)(en-US): I heard you humans have a splendid\ncustom called ‘writing a diary.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너희에게 일기라는 근사한 풍습이 있다고 들었어.

English (United States)(en-US): Did the beings on the Moon tell you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 이들이 그랬니?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, they said humans write\nabout their day before it ends.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응 응. 하루가 끝나기 전에\n하루에 대한 감상을 적는 건데,

English (United States)(en-US): It lets you see what is unseen,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 보이지 않는 것을 보게 해주고,

English (United States)(en-US): and makes what is special even more so.\nA magical ritual, don’t you think?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 소중한 것을 더욱 소중하게\n해 주는 마법 같은 의식이래.

English (United States)(en-US): (The beings on the Moon... They really\nseem to value humans in a special way.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (달의 이들... 그들은 인간을 정말\n특별하게 생각해 주고 있는 것 같아.)

English (United States)(en-US): I have a leftover notebook and a pen.\nWould you like to use it to write a diary?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나한테 남는 노트와 펜이\n있는데, 뭉치가 이걸 쓸래?

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Some kind of water seems to blur my vision.\nIs this what thankfulness feels like?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눈 아래에서 찰랑이는 느낌이\n들어. 이게 고마움이라는 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): (It seems I’ve made an emotional friend.)|(Huh, they’re cute...!)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (아주... 감성적인 친구가 생겨 버렸네.)|(뭐야, 귀엽잖아.... 정이 들 것만 같아.)

English (United States)(en-US): Anyway...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그나저나....

English (United States)(en-US): It was true. I wrapped today in my diary\n—now I see what was unseen,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말이었어. 오늘을 일기 속에 담아 두고\n나니 보이지 않던 것들이 보이고,

English (United States)(en-US): And what was special\nsparkles even more so.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 소중해하던 것들이\n더욱 반짝이게 되었어.

English (United States)(en-US): Um... If it’s alright with you, I’d like\nto keep my writings to myself.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 있지... 괜찮다면 내 일기는\n<nickname>에게 비밀로 하고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): Can you promise me\nyou won’t ever read it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 절대 열어 보지 않기로\n약속해 줄 수 있지?

English (United States)(en-US): Sure, I promise. Your secrets are safe.|Only if you hide it well enough!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼, 비밀 지킬게. |잘 숨겨 놓는다면!

English (United States)(en-US): Thank you! Our secret will remain\nsafe under the bed forever!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고마워. 우리 비밀은 침대 밑에\n영원히 감춰져 있을 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): Of course! I’m going to hide it\nso well under the bed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 좋아! 침대 밑에 꽁꽁\n철저하게 숨겨 놓겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, I plan to\nfall asleep soon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 나는 이제\n잠에 빠져들 계획이야.

English (United States)(en-US): I discovered somewhere very snuggly\nunder the bed just before,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아까 침대 밑에서 아주 포근해\n보이는 무언가를 발견했는데,

English (United States)(en-US): May I please use it\nas my place of sleep?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혹시 내가 그곳을 내 잠의\n공간으로 사용해도 될까?

English (United States)(en-US): Under the bed...? Where?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 침대 밑...? 어디?

English (United States)(en-US): Here!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 여기!

English (United States)(en-US): Uh, ugh. It’s a spiderweb.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어, 어라. 거미줄이네.

English (United States)(en-US): (Gaaah!)|(Eeeew.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (으아아악.)|(하아아아....)

English (United States)(en-US): Spiderweb? Spiderweb.\nSpiderweb.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 거미줄? 거미줄. 거미줄.

English (United States)(en-US): Is it ‘spider’ plus ‘web’?\nWhat is a spider? Spider. Spider!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘거미’ 더하기 ‘줄’인 걸까?\n거미란 뭘까? 거미. 거미!

English (United States)(en-US): After some sleep,\nI plan to study ‘spiders.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 한숨 자고 일어나면\n‘거미’에 대해 공부해 볼 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps then I’ll learn the secret\nto this plush sleeping spot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 폭신한 잠 공간의 비밀을\n알게 될 수 있을지도 모르지.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, when I wake up, let’s walk and\ndaydream and think even more together!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 <nickname>, 자고 일어나면. 너와 함께\n또 산책과 공상과 사유의 모험을 할래!

English (United States)(en-US): My heart feels so giddy and full,\nit feels like it’s going to float away...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하아암. 마음이 들떠\n날아가 버린다면....

English (United States)(en-US): Up, up, and away...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어쩌지....
